title: Magnetism compare B field for current slabs

content.description: Three thin, conducting slabs in the <math alttext="x z" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mi>z</mi></math>-plane have uniform current densities directed in the <math alttext="negative z" overflow="scroll"> <mo>−</mo> <mi>z</mi> </math>-direction, as shown. The magnitude <math alttext="J" overflow="scroll"><mi>J</mi></math> of the current density and the thickness of each slab are indicated, as is the distance to a point labeled <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math> from the middle of each slab. The widths of all three sheets along the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis are much greater than the distance to point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math>.
content.question: Which of the following correctly compares the magnitude of the magnetic fields <math alttext="B sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="B sub 2" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>B</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </math>, and <math alttext="B sub 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math> near slabs <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, B sub 1 equals B sub 2, close parenthesis, is greater than B sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>
